title: Alzheimer's Dementia
Definition: Amyloid plaques and neurofibrillary dysfuction leads to dysfucntion of ACh neurones. Pathology: Atrophy, Widened sulci, dilate ventricles
Symptoms: BPSD: changes in behaviour, changes in affect, psychotic symptoms. Specific: Anterograd memory loss
Management: patient adaptations, social support, carer support, optimise physical health, psychotherapy, psychotropic medication
